H0.text: Enzymes serve as catalysts for reactions that break large food molecules into smaller useful molecules.

H1.text: Vitamins serve as catalysts for reactions that break large food molecules into smaller useful molecules.

H2.text: Lipids are substances that serve as catalysts for reactions that break large food molecules into smaller useful molecules.

H3.text: Nucleotides serve as catalysts for reactions that break large food molecules into smaller useful molecules.

A4.text: Enzymes such as amylases and proteases break down large molecules (starch or proteins, respectively) into smaller ones, so they can be absorbed by the intestines.

A5.text: Enzymes are known to catalyze over 5,000 types of biochemical reactions.
